Furthermore, what are TEO shareholders thinking of the Vodafone agreement to share best practices?Vodafone has the cable-cellular model and is huge. In any case, reaching out for sharing of business development strategies seems very smart for a company so recently merged with another company. It gives a higher intelligence to how to go forward perhaps in Argentina with cable and cellular together.Anyone think this might be a precursor to a buyout of TEO by Vodafone?One of the few continents Vodafone does not play is South America, and I don't believe they play in North America either.

TEO is no longer declared as Public Service, and may now increase fees for customers, this is bullish.https://www.ambito.com/politica/telecomunicaciones/la-justicia-suspendio-el-dnu-que-declaro-servicio-publico-las-n5188972
